raw_output:
system
You are a helpful AI for medical imaging.
user
System:
You are extracting factual relations from a medical imaging lecture. Use only information grounded in the input SLIDE_TEXT.

User:
SLIDE_TEXT:
Think of ripples in a pond. If you drop a stone at one point, the ripples spread out. If you drop it at another point, the same pattern emerges—just shifted in space. This is an example of spatial invariance in a system.

STRICT INSTRUCTIONS:
- Return JSON only. No prose, no markdown, no code fences.
- Output a triple only if both subject and object appear verbatim in SLIDE_TEXT (case-insensitive).
- Predicates must be one of: uses | via | represents | depends_on | measures | produces | reconstructs_with.
- Add modalities ["text"] by default; add "image" only if clearly visible without the text.
- Confidence in [0,1].

OUTPUT:
{
  "triples": [
    {"s":"<verbatim subject>", "p":"uses|via|represents|depends_on|measures|produces|reconstructs_with",
     "o":"<verbatim object>", "modalities":["text","image"], "confidence":0.0, "evidence":"<short quote from SLIDE_TEXT>"}
  ]
}

assistant
{
  "triples": [
    {
      "s": "ripples in a pond",
      "p": "represents",
      "o": "spatial invariance in a system",
      "modalities": [
        "text",
        "image"
      ],
      "confidence": 0.9,
      "evidence": "Think of ripples in a pond. If you drop a stone at one point, the ripples spread out. If you drop it at another point, the same pattern emerges—just shifted in space. This is an example of spatial invariance in a system."
    }
  ]
}

triples.evidence: Think of ripples in a pond. If you drop a stone at one point, the ripples spread out. If you drop it at another point, the same pattern emerges-just shifted in space. This is an example of spatial invariance in a system.
